levels.name: Shikamaru Nara
levels.description: You are now Shikamaru. He may not be the strongest, but his super-smart brain is his ultimate weapon. With his shadow powers, he can trap anyone who underestimates him. You're now a clever ninja strategist!

levels.name: Temaru
levels.description: Awesome—you've unlocked Temari! With her giant fan, she can whip up slicing wind attacks that knock enemies off their feet. She crushed Tenten with ease and even helped take down one of the Sound Four when Shikamaru was in trouble. A master of long-range battles, Temari is a powerful ally who shows that brains and wind make the perfect combo!

levels.name: Choji Akimichi
levels.description: Nice! You've reached Choji. Don't be fooled—when Choji gets serious, he's unstoppable! He can grow huge and crush his enemies. You've unlocked hidden strength that surprises everyone.

levels.name: Neji Hyuga
levels.description: Awesome! You've become Neji, the Hyuga genius. With your Byakugan, you can see enemy moves before they happen. You're a natural-born prodigy, feared in battle!

levels.name: Rock Lee
levels.description: Hard work pays off—you're now Rock Lee! You can unleash amazing Taijutsu, move faster than the eye can see, and even fight drunk-style if needed. You're proof that training beats talent!

levels.name: Gaara
levels.description: Whoa—you've unlocked Gaara! With sand that obeys your every command, you're one of the scariest Genin ever. Few dare to fight you… and those who do regret it.

levels.name: Sasuke Uchiha
levels.description: Impressive! You're now Sasuke, the Uchiha prodigy. With the Sharingan and the Curse Mark, you're strong enough to rival even Naruto. You've got the power and the cool factor.

levels.name: Naruto Uzumaki
levels.description: Believe it—you've reached Naruto! You can summon giant toads, tap into the Nine-Tails' chakra, and never give up. You're destined for greatness—Hokage level is in sight!

levels.name: Kiba Inuzuka
levels.description: You've unlocked Kiba and his trusty partner Akamaru! With super-sharp senses, lightning-fast reflexes, and a wild fighting style, Kiba fights like a true ninja wolf. Even Naruto had a tough time keeping up with him! Together with Akamaru, his combo attacks can tear through almost any opponent. Fierce, loyal, and fearless—you're now running with the pack!

levels.name: Shikamaru Nara
levels.description: Smart and steady—you're Shikamaru the Chunin now! With your 200 IQ battle plans, you can outthink anyone, even stronger enemies. A true master of strategy!

levels.name: Temari
levels.description: You've leveled up to Temari! With your giant fan, you summon mighty wind blades that can blow enemies away. You're sharp, strong, and always in control of the battlefield!

levels.name: Neji Hyuga
levels.description: You're Neji at Chunin level! Your Byakugan is so powerful that even Jonin are impressed. You see everything and strike with unbeatable precision. A true prodigy at work!

levels.name: Rock Lee
levels.description: You've reached Rock Lee! With Guy-sensei's training and your unstoppable Taijutsu, you fight with the heart of a lion. Open those gates and show your fiery spirit!

levels.name: Sasuke Uchiha
levels.description: Chunin Sasuke unlocked! Faster, stronger, and cooler than ever—you now wield the Sharingan like a pro. Enemies beware: your lightning power is growing!

levels.name: Gaara
levels.description: You're Gaara, the sand master! Even at Chunin exams, no one wanted to face you. With sand that shields and attacks, you're nearly unbeatable. Total boss move!

levels.name: Naruto Uzumaki
levels.description: Believe it—you're Chunin Naruto! You can use the Nine-Tails' chakra and summon giant toads. From underdog to hero, you've become a true force of nature!

levels.name: Pakura
levels.description: Incredible—you've reached Pakura, the blazing hero of the Sand! Feared across the ninja world, she wields the rare Scorch Release, creating fiery orbs that burn hotter than the sun. One touch is enough to defeat an enemy instantly, and with a massive orb, she can scorch entire battlefields. Once hailed as her village's brightest kunoichi, Pakura's power makes her a legend of flame and fury!

levels.name: Neji Hyuga
levels.description: You're Jonin Neji! Your Byakugan is unmatched, and you've become a leader in battle. You're a genius warrior who inspires your entire clan.

levels.name: Might Guy
levels.description: Fired up—you've unlocked Might Guy! With blazing Taijutsu and endless energy, you prove that hard work can rival any genius. Youth power unleashed!

levels.name: Shisui Uchiha
levels.description: Awesome! You've become Shisui, the fastest Uchiha. With your Sharingan and Body Flicker, enemies can't even see you move. You're unstoppable speed!

levels.name: Fugaku Uchiha
levels.description: You've ranked up to Fugaku, leader of the Uchiha! With deadly fire jutsu and unmatched shuriken skills, you're a clan head with burning power.

levels.name: Sakumo Hatake
levels.description: You're Sakumo, the White Fang! With your glowing blade, you strike fear into enemies. Even the strongest ninjas know to respect your lightning-fast skills.

levels.name: Killer B
levels.description: Yo! You've unlocked Killer B, the Eight-Tails' best buddy. With rap, rhymes, and beast power, you're both awesome and unstoppable. Perfect Jinchuriki vibes!

levels.name: Jiraiya
levels.description: Legend unlocked—you're Jiraiya, the Toad Sage! Teacher of legends, master of Rasengan, and total wild card. You're powerful, wise, and hilarious all at once!

levels.name: Kakashi Hatake
levels.description: Congrats, you're Kakashi the Hokage! The Copy Ninja with a thousand jutsu is now the leader of the Leaf. Cool, calm, and legendary.

levels.name: Tsunade Senju
levels.description: You're Tsunade, the Fifth Hokage! With super strength and healing powers, you're the legendary medic who can crush boulders and save lives.

levels.name: Tobirama Senju
levels.description: You're Tobirama, the Second Hokage! Genius inventor and water-style master, you created powerful jutsu that changed the ninja world forever.

levels.name: Minato Namikaze
levels.description: You're Minato, the Yellow Flash! With speed too fast to see and a heart of gold, you're a hero who saved the village with ultimate sacrifice.

levels.name: Hiruzen Sarutobi
levels.description: You're Hiruzen, the Third Hokage! Known as the Professor, you know every jutsu in the village. Wise, kind, and powerful—you're the grand master of Konoha.

levels.name: Hashirama Senju
levels.description: You're Hashirama, the First Hokage! With Wood Style powers and the strength to fight Madara and the Nine-Tails, you're a true legend of Konoha.

levels.name: Naruto Uzumaki
levels.description: Believe it—you've finally become Hokage Naruto! With Sage Mode, Kurama's power, and the will to never give up, you're the strongest Hokage ever!

levels.name: Tobirama Senju
levels.description: You're Legendary Tobirama! Not only a Hokage but also a ninja genius who shaped the future of Konoha. Your wisdom and power make you unforgettable.

levels.name: Kakashi Hatake
levels.description: Legendary Kakashi unlocked! With lightning speed, Sharingan mastery, and endless coolness, you're one of the most powerful ninjas ever.

levels.name: Uchiha Obito
levels.description: You've unlocked the masked legend Obito Uchiha! Once thought lost, he returned as the mysterious Tobi—going from prankster to mastermind of the Akatsuki. With his space-warping Mangekyo Sharingan, Obito can slip through attacks and control battles like no other. Though his heart was broken by tragedy, his power grew so immense that even the strongest shinobi trembled before him. From underdog to unstoppable force, you now wield the might of a ninja who nearly changed the entire world!

levels.name: Uchiha Itachi
levels.description: You've unlocked the legendary Itachi Uchiha! A genius since childhood, he became one of the youngest Anbu captains ever. With his Sharingan and Mangekyo powers, even the strongest shinobi feared him. Though branded a rogue ninja and Akatsuki member, Itachi carried a hidden mission—protecting the Leaf and his little brother at all costs. Calm, mysterious, and unbelievably powerful, you now wield the strength and wisdom of one of the greatest ninjas in history.

levels.name: Minato Namikaze
levels.description: You're Legendary Minato, the Yellow Flash remembered across the world! Even in sacrifice, your speed and bravery live on forever.

levels.name: Sasuke Uchiha
levels.description: Legendary Sasuke! With the Eternal Mangekyo Sharingan and endless power, you're one of the most feared and respected ninjas ever.

levels.name: Naruto Uzumaki
levels.description: Legendary Naruto unlocked! With Sage Mode, Kurama, and thousands of shadow clones, you're the unstoppable hero of the ninja world.

levels.name: Madara Uchiha
levels.description: You've become Madara, the ultimate Uchiha! With the Eternal Mangekyo Sharingan and Perfect Susanoo, you're nearly godlike in power.

levels.name: Kaguya Otsutsuki
levels.description: Final form unlocked—you're Kaguya, the Mother of Chakra! With powers beyond imagination, you're the strongest being in the ninja world. True god-tier!

questions.question: What does the word 'abate' most nearly mean?
questions.explanation: Abate means to lessen or reduce.

questions.question: 'Abhor' is closest in meaning to:
questions.explanation: Abhor means to hate deeply.

questions.question: Which word best fits: The scientist received a/an ___ for her discoveries.
questions.explanation: Accolade means an honor or award.

questions.question: What does 'admonish' mean?
questions.explanation: Admonish means to warn or caution.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: He was ___ at solving complex puzzles.
questions.explanation: Adroit means skillful and clever.

questions.question: Which word best describes 'adverse' conditions?
questions.explanation: Adverse means unfavorable or harmful.

questions.question: An 'advocate' is someone who:
questions.explanation: Advocate means to recommend or support.

questions.question: 'Affable' is best described as:
questions.explanation: Affable means friendly and pleasant to talk to.

questions.question: What does 'affinity' mean?
questions.explanation: Affinity means a natural attraction or connection.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The family lived in ___, with a mansion and cars.
questions.explanation: Affluence means wealth.

questions.question: An 'agnostic' is someone who:
questions.explanation: An agnostic believes God is unknown or unknowable.

questions.question: 'Agrarian' relates to:
questions.explanation: Agrarian means related to farming.

questions.question: Which term refers to a narrative with hidden meanings?
questions.explanation: Allegory is a story that uses figurative language to convey ideas.

questions.question: What does 'allocate' mean?
questions.explanation: Allocate means to set aside or apportion.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The teacher seemed to ___ to the test results.
questions.explanation: Allude means to refer indirectly.

questions.question: 'Altercation' is closest in meaning to:
questions.explanation: Altercation means a dispute or noisy quarrel.

questions.question: What does 'ameliorate' mean?
questions.explanation: Ameliorate means to make something better.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the word 'amiable'?
choices: Her amiable personality made her well-liked by everyone.
The amiable storm destroyed the town.
He shouted in an amiable tone at his enemies.
The desert is amiable with no plants.
questions.answer: Her amiable personality made her well-liked by everyone.
questions.explanation: Amiable means pleasant and kind.

questions.question: What does 'amnesty' mean?
questions.explanation: Amnesty is a pardon, usually for political offenses.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Without laws, the country fell into ___.
questions.explanation: Anarchy means absence of government or law.

questions.question: 'Animosity' is best described as:
questions.explanation: Animosity means strong dislike or hatred.

questions.question: Which best defines 'anomaly'?
questions.explanation: An anomaly is something irregular or an exception.

questions.question: An 'anthology' is:
questions.explanation: Anthology means a collection of literary pieces.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: He felt strong ___ toward his rival.
questions.explanation: Antipathy means dislike.

questions.question: 'Antithesis' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Antithesis is the direct opposite of something.

questions.question: What does 'apathy' mean?
questions.explanation: Apathy means indifference or lack of interest.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: She handled the tough situation with ___.
questions.explanation: Aplomb means self-confidence.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Climbing the mountain was a/an ___ task.
questions.explanation: Arduous means difficult or requiring effort.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The ___ student quickly solved the riddle.
questions.explanation: Astute means shrewd or clever.

questions.question: An 'atheist' is a person who:
questions.explanation: An atheist does not believe in God.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: His muscles began to ___ after months in bed.
questions.explanation: Atrophy means to waste away or shrink.

questions.question: What does 'attest' mean?
questions.explanation: Attest means to confirm something is true.

questions.question: 'Audacious' is best described as:
questions.explanation: Audacious means bold or daring.

questions.question: What does 'augment' mean?
questions.explanation: Augment means to increase or make greater.

questions.question: Which event would be considered 'auspicious'?
questions.explanation: Auspicious means favorable or promising success.

questions.question: 'Authoritative' is best described as:
questions.explanation: Authoritative means having authority or commanding.

questions.question: An 'autocratic' ruler is:
questions.explanation: Autocratic means arrogant or absolute in power.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The region fought for political ___.
questions.explanation: Autonomy means self-government.

questions.question: 'Avarice' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Avarice means extreme greed.

questions.question: What does 'avow' mean?
questions.explanation: Avow means to declare openly and without shame.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: He would often ___ at following the strict rules.
questions.explanation: Balk means to stop short or refuse to continue.

questions.question: 'Bane' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Bane means a curse or cause of harm.

questions.question: 'Beguile' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Beguile means to trick or deceive.

questions.question: 'Benign' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Benign means harmless or kindly.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The army was ___ on all sides.
questions.explanation: Beset means to attack from all sides.

questions.question: 'Blatant' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Blatant means offensively loud or obvious.

questions.question: 'Brusque' is best described as:
questions.explanation: Brusque means abrupt or blunt in manner.

questions.question: What does 'bureaucracy' mean?
questions.explanation: Bureaucracy means government managed through departments or bureaus.

questions.question: To 'canvass' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Canvass means to seek support or make a survey.

questions.question: 'Carnage' is best described as:
questions.explanation: Carnage means great slaughter of people.

questions.question: 'Censure' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Censure means to criticize sharply.

questions.question: 'Chagrin' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Chagrin means embarrassment or distress.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The monk lived a ___ life.
questions.explanation: Chaste means morally pure.

questions.question: What does 'chauvinism' mean?
questions.explanation: Chauvinism means fanatical patriotism or prejudice.

questions.question: To 'chide' means:
questions.explanation: Chide means to scold or rebuke.

questions.question: A 'chronicle' is:
questions.explanation: Chronicle means a factual written account of events.

questions.question: 'Circumspect' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Circumspect means watchful and cautious.

questions.question: What does 'colloquial' mean?
questions.explanation: Colloquial means informal or conversational language.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Pay should be ___ with effort.
questions.explanation: Commensurate means in proportion.

questions.question: 'Complacent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Complacent means being overly content and unconcerned.

questions.question: What does 'concomitant' mean?
questions.explanation: Concomitant means occurring together or accompanying.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: They offered their ___ after the loss.
questions.explanation: Condolence means expression of sympathy.

questions.question: What does 'configuration' mean?
questions.explanation: Configuration means arrangement or setup.

questions.question: 'Congenital' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Congenital means present from birth.

questions.question: To 'connote' is to:
questions.explanation: Connote means to suggest or imply.

questions.question: 'Consternation' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Consternation means sudden confusion or dismay.

questions.question: 'Contiguous' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Contiguous means adjacent or touching.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The success of the plan is ___ on funding.
questions.explanation: Contingent means dependent or possible.

questions.question: To 'corroborate' is to:
questions.explanation: Corroborate means to confirm or support.

questions.question: A 'credible' story is:
questions.explanation: Credible means believable.

questions.question: What does 'cult' mean?
questions.explanation: Cult means obsessive devotion to a person or idea.

questions.question: 'Deference' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Deference means respectful submission or regard.

questions.question: What does 'dichotomy' mean?
questions.explanation: Dichotomy means a split into two parts.

questions.question: To 'disparage' means:
questions.explanation: Disparage means to speak of as unimportant or inferior.

questions.question: What does 'disparity' mean?
questions.explanation: Disparity means a lack of equality or difference.

questions.question: To 'disseminate' information means:
questions.explanation: Disseminate means to spread widely, often information.

questions.question: 'Dissident' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: A dissident is someone who disagrees with authority.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: He drank the ___ of the coffee cup.
questions.explanation: Dregs means the remnants or leftovers at the bottom.

questions.question: An 'effigy' is:
questions.explanation: Effigy means a crude representation of a person.

questions.question: To 'elicit' a response means:
questions.explanation: Elicit means to draw out a response or reaction.

questions.question: What does 'elucidate' mean?
questions.explanation: Elucidate means to make something clear or explain.

questions.question: 'Emaciated' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Emaciated means abnormally thin due to illness or lack of food.

questions.question: Light seemed to ___ from the candle.
questions.explanation: Emanate means to flow out or issue forth.

questions.question: To 'embezzle' means:
questions.explanation: Embezzle means to steal money entrusted to one's care.

questions.question: An 'empirical' study is based on:
questions.explanation: Empirical means based on observation or experience.

questions.question: To 'emulate' someone means:
questions.explanation: Emulate means to imitate with the goal of matching or surpassing.

questions.question: 'Enigma' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Enigma means something mysterious or difficult to understand.

questions.question: To 'enjoin' is to:
questions.explanation: Enjoin means to legally prohibit or strongly command.

questions.question: 'Ephemeral' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Ephemeral means lasting a very short time.

questions.question: He is the ___ of kindness.
questions.explanation: Epitome means a perfect example of a quality.

questions.question: An 'equitable' solution is:
questions.explanation: Equitable means just and fair.

questions.question: 'Equivocal' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Equivocal means ambiguous or uncertain.

questions.question: An 'ethical' decision follows:
questions.explanation: Ethical means following accepted rules of conduct.

questions.question: What does 'ethnic' relate to?
questions.explanation: Ethnic relates to cultural or racial groups.

questions.question: At funerals, a ___ is often given to honor the dead.
questions.explanation: Eulogy means a formal speech of praise for someone, often after death.

questions.question: To 'exacerbate' a problem is to:
questions.explanation: Exacerbate means to make a problem more severe.

questions.question: To 'exculpate' someone is to:
questions.explanation: Exculpate means to clear someone of blame.

questions.question: What does 'exonerate' mean?
questions.explanation: Exonerate means to free from blame or responsibility.

questions.question: 'Exorbitant' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Exorbitant means unreasonably high or excessive.

questions.question: To 'expound' means:
questions.explanation: Expound means to explain in detail.

questions.question: To 'extol' is to:
questions.explanation: Extol means to praise enthusiastically.

questions.question: 'Extraneous' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Extraneous means irrelevant or unrelated.

questions.question: To 'extricate' means:
questions.explanation: Extricate means to free from difficulty.

questions.question: If someone begins to 'falter', they:
questions.explanation: Falter means to hesitate or lose strength, often stumbling.

questions.question: A 'fastidious' person is:
questions.explanation: Fastidious means very attentive to detail and hard to satisfy.

questions.question: A 'feasible' plan is:
questions.explanation: Feasible means capable of being done.

questions.question: To 'feign' means:
questions.explanation: Feign means to pretend or fake.

questions.question: 'Felicity' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Felicity means great happiness.

questions.question: To 'ferret out' information means to:
questions.explanation: Ferret means to search out persistently.

questions.question: 'Fervent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Fervent means showing intense emotion.

questions.question: A 'fetish' is:
questions.explanation: Fetish means an obsessive attachment to something.

questions.question: A 'flagrant' violation is:
questions.explanation: Flagrant means glaring or shocking.

questions.question: A 'flamboyant' outfit is:
questions.explanation: Flamboyant means flashy and showy.

questions.question: To 'flaunt' wealth is to:
questions.explanation: Flaunt means to display proudly or boldly.

questions.question: A 'forensic' report relates to:
questions.explanation: Forensic means related to legal or public debate.

questions.question: Her 'forte' is playing the piano. 'Forte' means:
questions.explanation: Forte means a strong ability or skill.

questions.question: 'Fortitude' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Fortitude means courage in pain or difficulty.

questions.question: A 'fortnight' is:
questions.explanation: Fortnight means a period of two weeks.

questions.question: 'Fortuitous' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Fortuitous means happening accidentally or by chance.

questions.question: A 'frugal' person is:
questions.explanation: Frugal means careful with money, thrifty.

questions.question: 'Garrulous' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Garrulous means excessively talkative.

questions.question: 'Generic' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Generic means common or general, not specific.

questions.question: In literature, 'genre' refers to:
questions.explanation: Genre means a category or type of art, music, or literature.

questions.question: 'Glib' speech is:
questions.explanation: Glib means fluent but shallow or insincere.

questions.question: A 'gregarious' person is:
questions.explanation: Gregarious means fond of company, sociable.

questions.question: 'Hapless' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Hapless means unlucky or unfortunate.

questions.question: A 'heinous' crime is:
questions.explanation: Heinous means shockingly evil or abominable.

questions.question: 'Heterogeneous' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Heterogeneous means made up of different kinds.

questions.question: A person's 'heyday' is their:
questions.explanation: Heyday means the peak or prime period of success.

questions.question: Taking a 'hiatus' means:
questions.explanation: Hiatus means a pause or break.

questions.question: To pay 'homage' means to show:
questions.explanation: Homage means special honor or respect.

questions.question: 'Ignominious' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Ignominious means deserving shame or disgrace.

questions.question: An 'illicit' activity is:
questions.explanation: Illicit means unlawful or forbidden.

questions.question: 'Immutable' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Immutable means something that cannot change.

questions.question: An 'impasse' is:
questions.explanation: Impasse means a situation with no escape or solution.

questions.question: 'Implicit' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Implicit means suggested or understood without being stated directly.

questions.question: An 'indigent' person is:
questions.explanation: Indigent means extremely poor.

questions.question: 'Indolent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Indolent means wanting to avoid activity; lazy.

questions.question: An 'ingenuous' child is:
questions.explanation: Ingenuous means innocent, naÃƒÂ¯ve, or honest.

questions.question: 'Inherent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Inherent means existing naturally as a permanent characteristic.

questions.question: An 'insidious' plan is:
questions.explanation: Insidious means proceeding in a subtle but harmful way.

questions.question: 'Insolvent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Insolvent means unable to pay debts; bankrupt.

questions.question: An 'interminable' speech is:
questions.explanation: Interminable means endless or seemingly without end.

questions.question: An 'intrepid' explorer is:
questions.explanation: Intrepid means fearless and adventurous.

questions.question: 'Intrinsic' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Intrinsic means belonging naturally, essential.

questions.question: Technical 'jargon' is:
questions.explanation: Jargon means words used by a specific group or profession.

questions.question: A 'keen' sense of smell is:
questions.explanation: Keen means sharp or highly developed.

questions.question: 'Latent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Latent means existing but not yet developed or obvious.

questions.question: A 'lethargic' person feels:
questions.explanation: Lethargic means tired or lacking energy.

questions.question: A 'lucid' explanation is:
questions.explanation: Lucid means easy to understand or very clear.

questions.question: 'Magnanimous' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Magnanimous means very generous and forgiving.

questions.question: A 'malevolent' person is:
questions.explanation: Malevolent means wishing harm or evil on others.

questions.question: Monetary policy relates to:
questions.explanation: Monetary means relating to money or currency.

questions.question: A 'myriad' of stars means:
questions.explanation: Myriad means a countless or great number.

questions.question: A 'nebulous' idea is:
questions.explanation: Nebulous means vague or unclear.

questions.question: 'Obscure' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Obscure means not clear or hard to understand.

questions.question: Obsolescence refers to:
questions.explanation: Obsolescence means the process of becoming obsolete or outdated.

questions.question: 'Ornate' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Ornate means elaborately decorated.

questions.question: To 'ostracize' someone is to:
questions.explanation: Ostracize means to exclude or banish.

questions.question: A 'palatable' meal is:
questions.explanation: Palatable means pleasant to the taste.

questions.question: 'Palpable' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Palpable means easily felt or obvious.

questions.question: A 'panacea' is:
questions.explanation: Panacea means a universal remedy for all problems.

questions.question: A 'paradigm' is:
questions.explanation: Paradigm means an example or model.

questions.question: A 'paradox' is a statement that:
questions.explanation: Paradox means a statement that seems self-contradictory but may be true.

questions.question: 'Perennial' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Perennial means enduring or lasting for many years.

questions.question: 'Periphery' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Periphery means the outer edge or boundary.

questions.question: A 'placid' lake is:
questions.explanation: Placid means peaceful and calm.

questions.question: In a court case, the 'plaintiff' is the one who:
questions.explanation: Plaintiff means the person who brings a case against another in court.

questions.question: 'Poignant' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Poignant means deeply touching or moving emotionally.

questions.question: 'Potent' most nearly means:
questions.explanation: Potent means having great power or effect.

questions.question: A 'precarious' situation is:
questions.explanation: Precarious means not secure, risky, or dangerous.

questions.question: To 'preclude' something means to:
questions.explanation: Preclude means to make something impossible or prevent it.

questions.question: A 'precursor' is:
